text: this animation demonstrates use of a
technology called medic M EDI C to
measure drug levels continuously in a
mouse
the catheterized mouse is injected with
a therapeutic dose of a drug a small
sample of the mouse's blood flows
through a channel in a chip that
contains optoma probes selectively for
the drug the abbe de mer with attached
redox groups shown in blue are tethered
to an electrode surface at the bottom of
the channel that sensing layer is
separated from the blood flow by a
diffusion filter a microns thick layer
of flowing buffer some of the drug
molecules pass through the filter and
bind to the AB de Mars causing the AB de
Mars to change shape this shape change
brings the redox groups closer to the
electrode surface generating an
electrochemical signal proportional to
analyte concentration
